result.execSummary:
The defendant Rashad T Reed was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and fees BY 12-04-2023 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law WITHIN ONE (1) YEAR, upon submission of motion.  EXPUNGEMENT IS NOT CONTINGENT UPON PAYMENT OF COSTS OR FEES.
Defendant sentenced to serve FIVE (5) DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence with credit for FIVE (5) DAYS time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief.

Defendant Rashad T Reed in court with attorney John c Glover.  Defendant Rashad T Reed in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  State moved to REVOKE the DPA.  Court went off the record to hold sidebar in Chambers.  Hearing continued on the Record.  Defense and Defendant CONCEDED that there is a FACTUAL basis for the REVOCATION.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.  Matter proceeded to sentencing before Br. 33.
Bail Motion by Defense.  Filed, sdg.
Filed, sdg.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services DISCHARGE REPORT dated November 13, 2018; received and filed.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney John c Glover in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel recently appointed by the Public Defender's Office. Court reviewed JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated November 12, 2018. Defense counsel advised the Court of Defendant's new case, 18CF5247, pending in Branch 10. State moves to REVOKE the DPA.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued. NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.
received and filed.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated November 12, 2018; received and filed.
Pretrial Services Violation Report 11-07-2018.  Filed, sdg.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing. 
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Rashad T Reed in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Defendant Rashad T Reed in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 33.  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 13, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Barbara K Due in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Attorney Barbara K Due in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defense requested any Warrant issued be STAYED.  State did NOT object.  Court ISSUED and STAYED a Bench Warrant until the next date.  If Defendant appears, Court WILL dismiss the matter.  Review hearing scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Rashad T Reed in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Court noted that Defendant has tested negative for ALL results AND has attended SIXTEEN OF SIXTEEN (16/16) meetings AND has completed 'Thinking for a Change'.  Defendant has all SIXTEEN (16) HOURS of Community Service completed but does NOT have verification.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Rashad T Reed in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. sdg
Defense reports that Defendant is in compliance. State concurs.  Review hearing scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Justice Point DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement. 
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.

The Court ordered no use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Rashad T Reed in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Review hearing scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Room 113 Safety Building on 08-03-2015 at 01:30pm
